Key Arguments: The legislation will lead to excessive censorship and legal uncertainty for online platforms.
Freedom of speech is essential and must be protected against censorship.
Historically, many ideas initially dismissed as false have later been proven true.
Decisions on misinformation should not be centralized to a few individuals.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech must be protected. Censorship is open to corruption.
Throughout human history, hotly contested or even nearly universally disbelieved ideas have turned out, years later, to be the truth.
Truth matters but what is truth should be open for debate in a secular, democratic society.
